column4: how shall I find all the cookies in my system and how can I get rid of them ?
how shall I find all the cookies in my system and how can I get rid of them ?
just tell firefox to delete all the cookies on closing
they are in the ~/.mozilla/firefox/????.default folder...but you will need to see what ???.default really is
it is different for each user
any strange stuff my pc behaving strange like sometimes the icone from my internet conection keep lighting without I'm being browsing ...
sometimes it will...it needs to communicate with the dhcp server and other places.
to know if it is a problem you really need to capture the packets with wireshark or some such tool and see what is being sent/received
I don't know how to analyse the packets that's the point...:(
like sometimes my browser shut down by itself...that's not normal...
No, that isn't normal. But I doubt that is a cookie issue.
do you get an error code when your browser shuts down?
no that's right I think that isn't my machine...
can you give some tips how to analyse the packages...like a book tutorial or whatever...

you might try this...instead of clicking on the firefox icon to run the program open a terminal and type 'firefox'. Then, when firefox crashes there should be some information in the terminal window about what happened.
I don't know of one, but there is plenty of information on the web about it. Start at the wireshark homepage
right I gonna have a look...cheers
